title: Springfest bloomin’ lovely
text:
Weather: Hobart 9 °C - 20 °C . Possible late shower. Entertainment Picture perfect days for Springfest at Royal Tasmanian Botanical Gardens by: Sisters Lucy, 7, left, and Madi Cleaves, 10, of Montrose, enjoy the sunshine and spring flowers at Springfest in the Royal Tasmanian Botanical Gardens. Picture: NIKKI DAVIS-JONES Source: News Limited 
A FESTIVAL to celebrate the season is in full swing at the Royal Tasmanian Botanical Gardens. 
There will be more presentations, entertainment and trade stalls at Springfest today after a picture perfect Hobart spring day drew garden lovers through the gates yesterday. 
The fine weather will continue today with a partly cloudy maximum of 22C. 
“It is a beautiful day here and a lot is going on, but it has been a bit quiet. We hope more people come out tomorrow,” RTBG acting director Mark Fountain said. 
“Those who have come in are really enjoying themselves and we will have lots of music and things for kids to do again on Sunday.” 
Among those at Springfest were Jodi Cleaves and her children, Lucy and Madi. 
“It was such a beautiful day and it was a lot of fun. The kids especially loved the dancing and the ponies,” Mrs Cleaves said.
